page.title: 05 INGESTRE STABLES.
page.content: The stables were built in 1884 at a cost of a quarter of a million pounds and covered 5-6 acres.It was built for the Earl of Shrewsbury but; later when he left the oak and iron stables were ripped out. The new owner Tim Downs refurnished the stables and bought a further 150 acres elsewhere and later took on a new partner Rob Lovatt. The stables provide a valuable farm of recreation which includes Treking and Riding Lessons. The stables consist of fourty horses which are cared for by 5 full time workers who have living quarters. They also have 6 part time employees. They have video cameras to watch foaling mares in case of difficulties; the mares dislike being openly watched.
